page.title: 16Tourism-Beamish
page.content:
{Staff and visitors
Th museum is a major source of employment in the area.It employs two hundred staff.This number is made up of 42 permanent staff,57 temporary workers and 101 people employed in 'job creation' positions. In the 1984 season 250,000 visitors came to Beamish.Of these 66,000 were from organised school parties from areas as far north as Glasgow and as far south as the Midlands. The museum relies heavily on advertising to attract visitors.It is also featured quite regularly on t.v. programmes.Following a recent 'Blue Peter' programme over 7,500 people attended the Whit Monday opening. Visitors always find the newest ehibit the most popular.We found that most letters are about the drift mine.
